channel.title: Laptop failure.
channel.description: Lately, I've been having problems with my old laptop. The OS is Windows XP Home, and whenever I get on my account, the WiFi light lights up on my keyboard, even when there is no wifi around, every 3 seconds I get this message popping up saying "Windows Explorer has encountered an error, Send Error Report, Don't Send." Explorer won't crash if I leave the message box open. I also cannot get on Internet Explorer nor Firefox without it crashing, and I can't access my Network Settings in Control panel. Could the NIC be burned out? What do you guys think? I do plan on installing Knoppix on it this weekend. I think the first mistake was buying a Dell. :|

item.title: Laptop failure.
item.dc:creator: Cool2
item.description:
Thanks for the help guys, I think I’m just going to format. As for doing a system restore, I’ve already tried that, doesn’t work.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop failure.
item.dc:creator: taxi_evil
item.description:
Roll it back to a restore point if you have one, its a nice easy solution

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop failure.
item.dc:creator: Level
item.description:
Sounds like you fucked with windows a little too much. Formatting completely would probably help. It doesn’t exactly sound like a hardware issue, so doing a clean install would be a good idea IMO.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop failure.
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Laptops are not immortal, at the very least install XP professional on it.

Eventually you might have to replace your hard drive or RAM.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop failure.
item.dc:creator: Lord_Grievous
item.description:
Try a Linux Live CD, if it still has this problem it’s probably a hardware failure, if not than it might just be something with Windows.

Read full topic
